title: OIP Sensor Systems
text:
OIP Sensor Systems is a Belgian defence and space company.
History.
The company was founded in <a href="Ghent">Ghent</a> in as (Precision Optics and Instruments), as an effort of Belgium to develop its own optical industry for its <a href="Belgian%20Armed%20Forces">army</a>.
From its foundation until the 1950s, OIP developed military lenses and objectives, medical and scientific microscopes, as well as cameras and photocopy machines for the industry. From the 1960s on, it was one of the first European companies to enter the emerging <a href="electro-optical">electro-optical</a> market, with innovations such as one of the first <a href="heads-up%20display">heads-up display</a> for the <a href="Lockheed%20F-104%20Starfighter">Lockheed F-104 Starfighter</a> and fire control systems for the <a href="Leopard%201">Leopard 1</a> battle tanks in <a href="Belgium">Belgium</a>, <a href="Canada">Canada</a> and <a href="Australia">Australia</a> together with <a href="SABCA">SABCA</a>. The company also manufactures <a href="holographic">holographic</a> <a href="night%20vision">night vision</a> googles, and participates in space projects.
On 1 July 2003, the company was acquired from <a href="Delft%20Instruments">Delft Instruments</a> () by <a href="Elbit%20Systems">Elbit Systems</a>.
